questions.question: What is Salesforce?
questions.answer: Salesforce is a cloud-based Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform that helps organizations manage customer interactions, sales processes, and business relationships in real-time.

questions.question: What is SOQL?
questions.answer: SOQL (Salesforce Object Query Language) is a query language that allows you to retrieve records from Salesforce using syntax similar to SQL. It can only query one object at a time.

questions.question: Explain Apex Triggers
questions.answer: Apex Triggers are pieces of code that execute before or after specific database events on a particular sObject in Salesforce. They can be used to update records, validate data, or perform business logic.

questions.question: What is Lightning Web Components?
questions.answer: Lightning Web Components (LWC) is a modern web components framework for building fast and scalable web applications using standard JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

questions.question: What is the difference between SOQL and SOSL?
questions.answer: SOQL (Salesforce Object Query Language) searches data in a single sObject, while SOSL (Salesforce Object Search Language) can search for text across multiple fields and objects simultaneously.

questions.question: What is a Trigger in Salesforce?
questions.answer: A Trigger is an Apex code that executes before or after a specific sObject database activity occurs (insert, update, delete, undelete). Triggers can be used to perform custom actions when specific conditions are met.

questions.question: What is a Trigger in Salesforce?
questions.answer: A Trigger is an Apex code that executes before or after a specific sObject database activity occurs (insert, update, delete, undelete). Triggers can be used to perform custom actions when specific conditions are met.
